VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 4 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
2023 Renewal: Corrective Action Plan was recorded during this reporting period as
a result of the Renewal inspection completed on 07/11/2023. This CAP contained
two violations for employee files regarding verification of high school diploma and
reference from unrelated person. The facility immediately received verification of
education and completed an updated reference check. The facility implemented a
checklist that specifically lays out what needs to be completed prior to hire and
notes what rule to reference for the human resource department.
Special Investigation 2023C0000128 with a CAP approval date of 02/23/2023 was
a result of a violation for Behavior Management. The staff involved within the
situation were provided one to one coaching. The facility updated all youth’s
behavioral plans and made sure they were easily accessible for staff to review. This
CAP was reviewed quarterly, and all action steps were completed timely.
Special Investigation 2024C0001001SI with a CAP approval date of 01/22/2024
was a result of a violation for staff not following the facility’s diligent search and
supervision policy. The facility terminated the employee that was involved within the
situation and completed training with the staff. The facility is currently complying
with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor CAP compliance with
no noted concerns.
Special Investigation 2024C0001102SI with a CAP approval date of 03/13/2024
was a result of a violation for staff not following the facility’s supervision policy. The
staff member involved within this incident was put on a progressive discipline plan
and practices improved on the unit in regard to coordinating coverage. The facility
is currently complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor
CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
3

PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. The Chief Administrator
reported since the last reporting period there has been slow movement with youth
admissions and discharges. This is due to the increase request of 1:1 staffing
needs for more acutely impaired youth and slow numbers in staff recruitment have
prevented an increase in census. The current youth within the facility are stable.
Over this past year a second mental health therapist has been hired and two
activity specialists. The BCBA model continues to be utilized with these youth
which has added more individualized plans to target specific client behaviors. In
the upcoming year, the leadership team, BCBA, and clinical team will continue to
develop the use of data metrics and behaviors driven treatment intervention as
coaching and training tools for the staff.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. Staff reported they have enjoyed incorporating the tools learned by the
BCBA specialist into their daily interactions with the youth. Staff reported they feel
that communication has been more streamlined from administration and feel
supported by upper management.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. The youth all reported feeling safe at the facility and feel that their
voice is heard. The youth reported they enjoy when staff take them outside or on
outings.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on July 11, 2024.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
